item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, November 28, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Malware can turn off webcam LED and record video, demonstrated on ThinkPad X230 (761 points | 418 comments)
2. Hetzner cuts traffic from 20 TB –> 1..5 TB on US VPSs (99 points | 48 comments)
3. Show HN: myphotos.site – Google photos to a website in 60 seconds (58 points | 25 comments)
4. Conversational Game Theory (73 points | 14 comments)
5. You can use C-Reduce for any language (368 points | 85 comments)
6. PRoot: User-space implementation of chroot, mount –bind, and binfmt_misc (73 points | 27 comments)
7. Show HN: TeaTime – distributed book library powered by SQLite, IPFS and GitHub (223 points | 46 comments)
8. In Praise of Print: Reading Is Essential in an Era of Epistemological Collapse (113 points | 104 comments)
9. Bananas: Cross-Platform screen sharing made simple (61 points | 9 comments)
10. Developing a cancer drug without Big Pharma: this hospital shows it can be done (120 points | 62 comments)
11. Show HN: Voice-Pro – AI Voice Cloning Magic: Transform Any Voice in 15 Seconds (143 points | 94 comments)
12. The Forgotten Story of How IBM Invented the Automated Fab (118 points | 26 comments)
13. Show HN: Feels Like Paper (203 points | 73 comments)

18. picoCAD – a tiny modeler for tiny models (137 points | 16 comments)
19. Show HN: App that asks ‘why?’ every time you unlock your phone (719 points | 347 comments)
20. Building a Phosphorescence Detector (23 points | 3 comments)
21. Device-detector: Universal Device Detection library from User Agent (74 points | 28 comments)
22. Shallow sports and deep social hierarchies: pecking orders aren't equal (15 points | 16 comments)
23. The Art and Mathematics of Genji-Ko (134 points | 7 comments)
24. NASA aircraft uncover Cold War nuclear missile tunnels under Greenland ice sheet (70 points | 23 comments)
25. Chebyshev Polynomials in the 16th Century (2022) (92 points | 31 comments)
26. The capacitor that Apple soldered incorrectly at the factory (484 points | 218 comments)
27. Ultra-low-latency, batching and concurrent queue for IPC in Java (90 points | 47 comments)
28. Launch HN: Keep (YC W23) – AIOps and alert management (86 points | 41 comments)
29. MIT Aluminum Bicycle Project 1974 (123 points | 90 comments)
30. Fugees Founder Pras Michél Speaks Out: 'I Never Wanted to Be a Spy' (79 points | 45 comments)
